description: Hebrew power words for Parasha Pack decks

shema.simpleDefinition: When you really pay attention with your ears AND your heart
shema.fullDefinition: To hear and internalize, to truly listen and understand
shema.visualAssociation: ear with heart inside, sound waves

kavod.simpleDefinition: Treating someone special because they matter
kavod.fullDefinition: Honor, respect, glory; treating others with dignity

simcha.simpleDefinition: A big happy feeling in your heart!
simcha.fullDefinition: Joy, gladness, happiness; the feeling of celebration

chesed.simpleDefinition: Doing nice things for others because you care
chesed.fullDefinition: Loving-kindness, grace, mercy; acts of goodness

emunah.simpleDefinition: Believing in something even when you can't see it
emunah.fullDefinition: Faith, trust, belief; confidence in God and goodness

ahavah.simpleDefinition: The warm feeling when you care about someone very much
ahavah.fullDefinition: Love, affection; deep caring for others

shalom.simpleDefinition: When everything feels calm and good
shalom.fullDefinition: Peace, wholeness, completeness; also used as greeting

todah.simpleDefinition: What you say when someone does something nice for you

teshuvah.simpleDefinition: When you make a mistake and want to make it better
teshuvah.fullDefinition: Repentance, return; the process of acknowledging wrongdoing and making amends
teshuvah.visualAssociation: turning around, heart changing, hug after apology

yirah.simpleDefinition: That amazing feeling when you see something SO big and special
yirah.fullDefinition: Awe, reverence, wonder; the feeling of encountering something greater than yourself
yirah.visualAssociation: wide eyes, mouth open in wonder, looking up
